blog.name: idekwutiwantmyurl2b
blog.title: gay
blog.description: this whole blog is gay writings-of-an-introvert.tumblr.com is my sideblog

body:
Listen.

Matt Mercer? A prince. So handsome. Incredibly smart. Probably the most organized. Ever.

MARISHA Ray? First name is all caps. Because she’s a queen. Best puncher.

Talesin Jaffe? Goth daddy. I said it. Fight me. 5-polytope. Can’t even be comprehended by mere mortal minds.

Sam Reigel? Emmy award winner. Gonna lead the gang to EGOTs. Best waify.

Liam O'Brien? Angsty fuck. Just look at his characters. A disaster. Good husbando.

Travis Willingham? A great dad. Good at dad jokes. A++ good hair. An absolute unit.

Laura Bailey? A baller. Harp music 30 hours a day, 8 days a week, 1,000 days a year. Even more of an absolute unit than Travis but they make a motherfucking Titan team of parents.

Ashley Johnson? A babe. We miss her. Always in our blindspots. I mean, hearts.

Brian Foster? A Cabbage. The best Cabbage. With a capital C. A good beard.

Henry? The best boy. We would die for him

Q? An absolute goddess. We all adore her.

Ronin? Titan baby of cuteness.

summary: Hey, fellow critical role fans! I may have missed something, but is there a reason why they’re not releasing the audio format...
body: Hey, fellow critical role fans! I may have missed something, but is there a reason why they’re not releasing the audio format for CR? I’ve been waiting on episode 52 and they’re apparently on 54 now? I know they have the youtube videos up, but they make for real good listening on my way to work. Thanks!

and I get why people are screaming ‘the Traveller’ at him

tags: i wrote this in the writing center and man was it an experience to switch tabs whenever ppl walked by lmao
summary:
Don’t get too close.
She knows what the old Beau would’ve thought. That she hadn’t. That she wasn’t planning on it. That she...
body:
Don’t get too close.

She knows what the old Beau would’ve thought. That she hadn’t. That she wasn’t planning on it. That she would never risk it because she might form attachments, but they never form them back. And it would’ve been true.

Somewhere along the way, that changed. She doesn’t know how or when or why but it’s terrifying. And exciting. And—

Well. Beau’s never really been able to pinpoint her feelings.

Isn’t it a good thing, though? To be close to them? To have people who give a shit if she lives or dies?

She remembers what it was like before. Old Beau was like a chain without an anchor. Punched because it felt good. Kicked because it hurt someone else. Drank because it numbed it all. Ran away because it was too hard to look back.

And now—she punches because it defends them. Kicks because it keeps the enemy away. Drinks because it’s a celebration and they just won, damn it. Runs towards her friends because they need help.

It’s better. She’s better.

Unless…

Red snow still haunts her nightmares. The slow arc of glaive to chest, the fierce resistance in her friend’s eyes. How the ground underneath her felt like it disappeared. That is what she sees in Dairon’s eyes now. If you’re close to someone, it means you can lose them. It means you have a vulnerability, a gap in your armor.

But she also knows that for every weakness, there’s another strength. For every gap in her armor, someone ready to defend or heal her. Having a family might make her more vulnerable, but she knows for sure it’s also made her a hell of a lot better.

Maybe that’s the truth for Dairon. Maybe that’s just how they have to live to survive. But she’s not Dairon.

So Beau does what she does best.

She lies.

Don’t get too close.

She knows what the old Beau would’ve thought. That she hadn’t. That she wasn’t planning on it. That she would never risk it because she might form attachments, but they never form them back. And it would’ve been true.

Well. Beau’s never really been able to pinpoint her feelings.

Isn’t it a good thing, though? To be close to them? To have people who give a shit if she lives or dies?

She remembers what it was like before. Old Beau was like a chain without an anchor. Punched because it felt good. Kicked because it hurt someone else. Drank because it numbed it all. Ran away because it was too hard to look back.

And now—she punches because it defends them. Kicks because it keeps the enemy away. Drinks because it’s a celebration and they just won, damn it. Runs towards her friends because they need help.

It’s better. She’s better.

Unless…

Red snow still haunts her nightmares. The slow arc of glaive to chest, the fierce resistance in her friend’s eyes. How the ground underneath her felt like it disappeared. That is what she sees in Dairon’s eyes now. If you’re close to someone, it means you can lose them. It means you have a vulnerability, a gap in your armor.

But she also knows that for every weakness, there’s another strength. For every gap in her armor, someone ready to defend or heal her. Having a family might make her more vulnerable, but she knows for sure it’s also made her a hell of a lot better.

Maybe that’s the truth for Dairon. Maybe that’s just how they have to live to survive. But she’s not Dairon.

So Beau does what she does best.

She lies.

summary: also, woooooo Artagan finally appears! I still have no ide who he is (except everybody screams The Traveller), but that leaves...
body:
also, woooooo Artagan finally appears! I still have no ide who he is (except everybody screams The Traveller), but that leaves Larkin and Raishan, excluding Vecna, for me to get formally acquainted with.

I have no idea who Larkin is, except either nobody or just Vax can’t find him.
I know Raishan is 99% a woman and most probably the green dragon. and I think she was mentioned already sometime ago.
and of course Vecna is the Big Bad.
